inclusion.criterion: focal breast pain, i.e. pain localizable by the patient to within one breast quadrant without other associated symptoms.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: women referred for imaging because of focal breast pain and women who report focal breast pain to the technologist or radiologist prior to imaging.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: diffuse, radiating, or axillary pain associated palpable findings at the site of pain skin changes (erythema, thickening) nipple changes (discharge, retraction)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: currently pregnant or breast-feeding history of recent trauma or infection of the affected breast history of ipsilateral breast cancer
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 31-year-old woman complaining of abdominal pain. The pain started last night as diffuse abdominal discomfort.
